answers.answer: How are you feeling currently? Any progress in answers? My Lp-PLA2 is 310 and Lp(a) is 150

Hi yen492 -   I'm feeling okay at this time, no more VTAC for a year or so.  My LPa has increased to 124 however, so it seems that as I age it gets higher.  I don't have the Lp-PLA2 and other numbers this time.  My overall cholesteral is 186 - so pretty good.  I have been on a statin (Lipitor) and have noticed that my diabetes markers are higher (still pre-diabetes) and I've been having some memory issues, so I'm not too happy about that!    But, I haven't been feeling any other ill effects so I'm glad about that.  I hope that you're doing well.

I just saw this now, hope you are feeling well! My numbers decreased while I was on pravastatin for 2 months, I had bad side effects and took myself iff.....since then I've been off the statins and my levels are even higher than originally. Any news on you?

You posted accidentally on the wrong forum (dogs) I have sent a report to admin, and hopefully they will be able to move your post to the High BP forum?Or you could copy-paste it and post it there yourself.Regards,Ginger899

question: My blood test results came back and my Lp-PLA2 level increased from 199 (optimal) to 308 (high risk).  My hs-CRP level increased from <0.3 to 0.4, which still in the optimal range.  my Apo B increased from 76 (intermediate risk) to 83 (high risk).  LDL-P increased from 1010 to 1225 (intermediate risk).I have high LP(a) - 91, and LP(a)-P - 290 - but those did not increase and as I understand - are hereditary.Does anyone know why there would be such a big jump in the Lp-PLA2 number and small increase in the others?  My other relevant numbers are total cholesterol - 191, LDL-C - 117.Thanks for any input!!     -     Juniper
title: Lp-PLA2 level - big increase
